scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You then acknowledged the team's feelings and opened the floor for discussion. Monica sighed and mentioned that discussing concerns won't expand the deadline. Bob muttered that the situation felt like a disaster waiting to happen. You then encouraged the team to stay focused and do their best. Monica, looking exasperated, said that they still had a mountain of work and no extra hands. You then proposed bringing in extra help or reallocating resources. Now, Bob, still looking skeptical, says, 'Even if we get more help, what if it's not enough in the end?'
scenes.description: Monica, tapping her pen on the table, adds, 'And what if the extra hands slow us down instead?'

options.text: I can understand your concerns, Bob. Let's focus on what we can control and make the best use of any additional resources we get.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's concerns and encouraged them to focus on controllable factors, demonstrating empathy and good social skills.

options.text: I know it's tough, but we need to stay positive. Additional help might not be perfect, but it's better than nothing.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay positive and work with what they have, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: If anyone has a better idea or thinks we should do something different, now's the time to speak up. Otherwise, let's move forward with the plan.
options.analysis: You opened the floor for suggestions but also emphasized moving forward with the plan, showing moderate emotion perception and self-regulation.
